definition: (onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)

sentences.english: If it doesn t crunch or crinkle, he wont eat it.
sentences.chinese: 不能发出嘎吱作响或者沙沙声儿的食物他是不会吃的。

sentences.english: From outside came the sounds of hissing steam and squeaking metal.
sentences.chinese: 从外面而来的蒸汽的嘶嘶声以及金属的嘎吱声。

sentences.english: Our feet crunched on the frozen snow.
sentences.chinese: 我们的双脚嘎吱作响地“踩”着冰冻的雪地。

sentences.english: The shoulder pole creaked under the weight of the luggage.
sentences.chinese: 行李压得扁担嘎吱嘎吱直响。

sentences.english: The shoulder pole creaked under the weight of the luggage.
sentences.chinese: 行李压得扁担嘎吱嘎吱直响。

sentences.english: The children crunched the celery sticks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们嘎吱嘎吱地嚼着芹菜梗。

sentences.english: The children crunched the celery sticks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们嘎吱嘎吱地嚼着芹菜梗。
我们双脚嘎吱做声地踩着碎石子。

sentences.english: I felt a thrill of terror as the door began to creak open.
sentences.chinese: 当门开始嘎吱一下打开时，我感到一阵恐怖袭上心头。

sentences.english: The cart rattled along the stony road.
sentences.chinese: 大车沿着石子路嘎吱嘎吱地前进。

sentences.english: The cart rattled along the stony road.
sentences.chinese: 大车沿着石子路嘎吱嘎吱地前进。

sentences.english: The door in the old house creaked noisily.
sentences.chinese: 老房子的门发出嘎吱嘎吱的响声。

sentences.english: The door in the old house creaked noisily.
sentences.chinese: 老房子的门发出嘎吱嘎吱的响声。

sentences.english: The door creaked open and Alice peered inside.
sentences.chinese: 门嘎吱作响地打开，爱丽丝眯着眼睛往里面瞧。

sentences.english: I signed in and crunched across the gravel to my room.
sentences.chinese: 我签到后嘎吱嘎吱走过石子路来到我的房间。

sentences.english: I signed in and crunched across the gravel to my room.
sentences.chinese: 我签到后嘎吱嘎吱走过石子路来到我的房间。

definition: (onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) breaking or snapping/(coll.) cut it out/stop it/also written 喀嚓[ka1 cha1]
